name: Pastel de Nata Cooking Class
tagline: Learn to bake Portugal's iconic custard tart from award-winning pastry chefs in a real Lisbon bakery

description.short: Experience the only hands-on cooking class in Lisbon where you'll learn to make authentic Pastel de Nata (Portuguese custard tarts) from professional pastry chefs inside a real Portuguese bakery. This 2-hour masterclass teaches you the traditional recipe, including homemade puff pastry techniques, in an intimate small-group setting.
description.full: The Pastel de Nata Cooking Class offers a truly authentic culinary experience in the heart of Lisbon, where passionate food enthusiasts can master the art of creating Portugal's most iconic pastry. Hosted at Nat'elier, an award-winning pastel de nata concept store in downtown Lisbon, this exclusive masterclass is led by Chef João Batalha - winner of the silver medal for Best Pastel de Nata in Portugal - or his team of expert pastry chefs including Silvia Sousa and Valeria Barros da Costa. Since 2018, thousands of students from around the world have learned the secrets of this beloved Portuguese treat in these professional kitchens. The 2-hour hands-on experience begins with an engaging introduction to the fascinating history of pastel de nata, which dates back to 1837 when monks at the Jerónimos Monastery in Belém first created these delectable tarts. Originally called Pastel de Belém, the recipe spread throughout Portugal and became known as Pastel de Nata. Participants don aprons and hairnets before stepping into the professional kitchen to discover the tools and techniques used daily by Portuguese pastry chefs. Unlike other cooking classes that use store-bought dough, this masterclass reveals the authentic method of making puff pastry from scratch, teaching the special lamination technique that creates the signature crispy, flaky layers. Students work together as a team while each participant gets hands-on experience shaping their own pastries, preparing the velvety custard filling, and perfecting the baking technique. The instructors share professional tips and tricks accumulated over years of experience, ensuring each student can successfully recreate the recipe at home. The magic moment arrives when the freshly baked tarts emerge from the oven, golden and fragrant. Participants gather to enjoy their warm creations accompanied by a comforting cup of coffee, experiencing the authentic taste of Portugal they've created with their own hands. Each student receives a Certificate of Achievement and takes home the recipe card to recreate these Portuguese treasures for family and friends. The experience celebrates both tradition and innovation in an environment that blends culinary skill-building with unforgettable cultural moments. The masterclass welcomes individuals, couples, families with children aged 8+, and groups including corporate team-building events. Previous corporate clients include Amazon, LinkedIn, Google, and OLX, testament to the quality and engagement of the experience.
description.history: The Pastel de Nata tradition began in 1837 at the Jerónimos Monastery in Belém, where Catholic monks created the original recipe using surplus egg yolks (egg whites were used to starch clothing). After the monastery closed in 1834 following the Liberal Revolution, the recipe was sold to a nearby sugar refinery, establishing the famous Pastéis de Belém bakery that still operates today with the original secret recipe. The pastry spread throughout Portugal, becoming known as Pastel de Nata. Chef João Batalha entered the hospitality business at age 13, embracing his family's baking tradition at Pastelaria Batalha. In 2018, he opened Nat'elier, a pastel de nata concept store in downtown Lisbon, and launched these masterclasses to share the traditional techniques with visitors from around the world. His award-winning recipe earned the silver medal for Best Pastel de Nata in Portugal, and his mission to make this Portuguese art accessible to everyone has welcomed over 10,000 students to date.
description.significance: This cooking class preserves and shares an essential element of Portuguese culinary heritage while making it accessible to international visitors. Pastel de Nata represents Portuguese confectionery art and cultural identity, and learning to make them authentically connects participants to centuries of Portuguese tradition. The experience goes beyond cooking to become a cultural immersion, teaching history, techniques, and the Portuguese passion for gastronomy.

directions.general: Located in the Baixa district of downtown Lisbon at Nat'elier bakery, Rua da Conceição 59. Easy walking distance from major attractions
directions.fromCruisePort: From cruise terminal at Santa Apolónia: 10-minute walk (800m) west along waterfront, or take metro Green Line 1 stop to Terreiro do Paço. From Alcântara terminal: metro Blue Line to Baixa-Chiado, then 5-minute walk
directions.publicTransport: Metro: Baixa-Chiado station (Blue/Green Lines) - 3-minute walk. Terreiro do Paço station (Blue Line) - 5-minute walk. Buses: 711, 714, 732, 736, 746, 759, 760, 781, 782, 783, 794. Tram 28E nearby
directions.parking: Limited street parking. Public parking: Praça da Figueira (5-minute walk), Martim Moniz (7-minute walk). Recommend public transport or walking

openingTimes.currentStatus: Classes offered daily with multiple time slots. Advance booking required

admissionPrices.notes: Standard group class (up to 12 participants): €60 per person. Children 8-12 years: €50. Private class (up to 16 participants): from €75 per person. Family packages available. Price includes: 2-hour hands-on class, all ingredients and equipment, recipe card to take home, Certificate of Achievement, fresh pastries to enjoy with coffee, and pastries to take away. Online classes also available via Udemy. Business consultancy available for professional bakers

visitingInformation.bestTimeToVisit: Morning classes (10am) popular for cruise passengers with afternoon free. Weekday classes typically smaller than weekends. Book 1-2 weeks in advance during peak season (May-September)
visitingInformation.adviceForVisitors: Book well in advance, especially for weekends and summer months. Classes conducted in English or bilingual (English/Portuguese). Wear comfortable clothing and closed-toe shoes. Hair tied back if long. Arrive 10 minutes early for check-in. No previous baking experience required. Suitable for ages 8+. Children under 18 must be accompanied by adult. Dietary restrictions can be accommodated with advance notice. Classes limited to 12 participants for personalized attention. Perfect rainy-day activity. Recipe cards provided so you can recreate at home. Pastries make great gifts for fellow cruise passengers

cruisePassengerInfo.timeNeededFromPort: 3-4 hours total (including travel time and class)
cruisePassengerInfo.accessibility: Excellent - central Baixa location minutes from cruise terminals. Easy walking or quick metro ride. Perfect half-day activity
